results.title: Night of dark shadows
results.brief_description: Adapted from the television series “Dark shadows” this film tells the story of artist Charles Collins and his new wife, and of things that go bump in the night. After moving into his recently inherited family mansion, Collins begins to experience strange dreams - dreams of the past, dreams that suddenly are not dreams any more. Will he follow the same path as his family before? Cast includes David Selby, Monica Rich, Christopher Pennock, Lara Parker, Grayson Hall, Diana Millay.

results.title: Jump jet
results.creator_credit: Derek Smith and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: The aeroplane was invented in the early 1900s. Since then there have been only three major breakthroughs in aviation: the jet, the helicopter, and the jump jet. Traces the development of the vertical take-off jet in Britain, with some reference to developments in other countries. Narrated by Richard Maddock.

results.title: Jumanji [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Joe Johnston, Scott Kroopf, William Teitler and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: For 26 years Adrian Parrish has been trapped inside an ancient board game called Jumanji. The two children who release him also unwittingly unleash a group of wild jungle creatures who go on a rampage. Alan must save his hometown from destruction or risk being exiled back into the game. Cast includes Robin Williams as Adrian Parrish.

results.title: It wasn't easy
results.creator_credit: Nico Crama, Arthur Hammond, National Film Board of Canada and Nederlandse Omroep Stichting
results.brief_description: Half a million people of Dutch origin live in Canada. This film looks at the unique character of the Dutch Canadians, their reasons for leaving the Netherlands and their contribution to Canadian society and culture. A cross section of Dutch Canadians living across Canada are interviewed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nico Crama, Arthur Hammond, National Film Board of Canada and Nederlandse Omroep Stichting

results.title: It takes a lot of help
results.creator_credit: John Peer Nugent and Core Communications Group
results.brief_description: Uses music by the Beatles, with narration by Lorne Greene, to explore the numerous avenues available to groups of citizens who are concerned with preventing drug abuse. Describes various of these avenues available both to the inidividual and communities combating drug abuse.

results.title: It takes a child: Craig Kielburger's story: a journey into child labour
results.creator_credit: Deborah Parks, Judy Jackson, Judy Films and TV Ontario
results.brief_description: Canadian born Craig Kielburger was 12 years-old when child labor activist Iqbal Massih (who was also only 12 years-old) was murdered in Pakistan. That event changed Craig’s life forever. In December 1995 Craig went on a seven week journey to South Asia including India and the Philippines, to see for himself the horrific situation of child labor and children who are sold and traded on the sex tourist market. In India, the number of unemployed adults is 55 million, whilst equally, the number of child workers is 55 million. Children are leased by their parents as collateral for a loan and remain bonded to the factory owners as the debt can never be repaid. As young as 5-year-olds can work upto 12 hours a day with no schooling, barely any food and paid a pittance, if paid at all. They are slave labor working in the most inhumane conditions. What Craig saw and the knowledge he gained turned him into a passionate, articulate and incredibly effective advocate on the children’s behalf. With a group of his peers, Craig founded “Free the Children”, a children’s organization completely run by young people, that now has 10,000 members in 20 countries across the world. This documentary acknowledges Craig’s dedication and testifies to the fact that even children can help bring about change through protest and involvement. Narrated by Jennifer Dale.

results.title: Misleading cases
results.creator_credit: Michael O'Connell, Russell Porter and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: A dramatised film of a lecture to medical students. Professor Bruce Kerr shows the ethical dilemma in dealing with cases, of not diagnosing the medical problem correctly. Doctors should look not only at the symptoms presented by the patients but also at their social situation which may also reveal the cause. He points out that medicine is the art of insight into the human condition. (Contains footage of Northcote and University of Melbourne.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael O’Connell, Russell Porter and Film Victoria

results.title: Miserables
results.creator_credit: Glenn Jordan, Norman Rosemont and ITC Entertainment
results.brief_description: Victor Hugo’s magnificent tale of the triumph of good over evil is a powerful story of pursuer and pursued. Set in France at the turn of the 18th Century, it follows a handsome young woodcutter, Jean Valjean (Richard Jordan), who is savagely sentenced for stealing a loaf and bears the burden of his guilt throughout his life. Befriended by a Bishop, he vows to lead a life of kindness and morality which he does but he is pursued by the obsessed Police Inspector Javert (Anthony Perkins), over a period of 20 tortured years until Javert commits suicide. Interwoven is a tale of the love between Cossette (Caroline Langrishe), the adopted daughter of Valjean, and Marius (Christopher Guard), who leads a group of insurrectionists against the Republic. The film’s climatic sequence is Government troops assaulting the rebel barricades and the subsequent uniting of the young couple.

results.title: Martin Scorsese directs
results.creator_credit: Joel Sucher, Steven Fischer and Pacific Street Film Projects
results.brief_description: This documentary visits the set, the editing rooms and the mixing studios during the production of “Goodfellas”. It also includes many clips from his body of work including “Mean Streets”, “Raging Bull”, “New York, New York” and “The Last Temptation of Christ”, as well as interviews with the director, his family, friends and colleagues from the film world such as Steven Spielberg, Robert De Niro, Harvey Keitel, Joe Pesci, and George Lucas.

results.title: Nighthawks. What can I do with a male nude?
results.creator_credit: Paul Hallam, Ron Peck, Four Corner Films and Nighthawks
results.brief_description: ‘Nighthawks’ pictures the everyday experiences of a homosexual schoolteacher in a film which is both a subjective account of the teacher’s disjointed emotional life, and a record of the gay scene in London towards the end of the 1970’s. ‘What can I do with a male nude?’ is a witty short film showing the point of view of a gay photographer as he photographs a muscular male model.
